E aprop am la tua ma dextra pren almagda, si le huel es senestre; o am la tua ma senestra, si le huel es de dreyt.	 And then with your right hand take a spoonful of honey if the nostril is the left one; or with your left hand, if it is the right one.
E aprop pausa la extremitat de almagda prop de la corona per la grossesa del ray en le album del huel de part del mendre lacrimal, e aprop enpelleys almagda am vertut e revol la tua ma am aquel.	 Then place the end of the spoon near the corner of the eye closest to the inner corner of the nostril on the side where the water is coming out, and then peel off the honey with skill and roll your hand with it.
E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	 "And then penetrate into the patient's stomach and feel that the wound has already been healed due to your treatment.
E cove que sia la masura del cami de almagda al preon la mesura del spazi le qual es de la pupilla entro a la fi de la negror, e es la corona del huel; quar tu veyras am aquel pupilla am la visio de l‚Äôhuel per la clartat de la tunica cornea.	 "And it should be the size of the path from the wound to the lung, which is the same as the distance from the pupil to the edge of the black part, and that is the crown of the eye; for you will see with that pupil the vision of the eye through the clarity of the cornea.
E aprop pausa almagda entro al loc en le qual es l‚Äôaygua, e aprop tu la atira en jos una veguada aprop autra, e donc si la aygua descen tantost, lahoras vetz le malaute aquo sobre le qual huebre la sua vista tantost, e almagda en le sieu huel.	 "Then press the wound into the place where there is water, and then you throw it down once or twice, and if the water comes out immediately, then you can see that the patient's vision will return quickly, and the wound in their eye.
E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	 "And then wait for a moment; if the water has come out, then you should press again before the wound is closed.
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l‚Äôaygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	 "And thus, when it is dry and does not come out, then you can easily remove the wound, and roll it with your hand a little at a time, and then dissolve a small amount of clear salt from a gem in water and wash the inside of the eye with it; and then place outside the eye a piece of cloth or wool soaked in rose oil and egg white, and bind the eye closed with water.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	 "But we and those of our time place (or apply) on that affliction a poultice made with egg white.
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l‚Äôhuel per la sua duricia ‚Äî quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot ‚Äî, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	 And if you do not obey your nurse during the treatment of the eye due to its hardness ‚Äî for it is one of those people whose eyes are very hard ‚Äî, then you must take the spatula which is called an "alberid," and this is its shape:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	 And therefore pierce with that, through that opening, and do not push your hand into the hole; this is so you can create a delicate path for the nurse.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	 And then the nurse will insert it as we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	 And you should complete the task of your work by preparing a well-ventilated bedroom in which the patient sleeps on their back in a darkened room, and all movement is forbidden.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	 And place on his nature that which makes his nature even; do not move his head to the right or left at all.
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	 And let the bandage be changed according to its condition every third day.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	 And then uncover him in that darkened room and expose his eye to the cold light; make him look at some objects, and then cover it again after seven days.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	 And you should not do this during the time of treatment or immediately before an infusion.
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	 Based on the context and similarities with Romance languages, here's a line-by-line translation of the given sentence:
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	 "But if an abscess occurs, it is necessary that you open the wound before the seventh day, and treat it with a remedy that can reduce the swelling.
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	 "At that time, you should cover the patient's face with a cloth and place it over their mouth to control their breathing for several days, keeping them in the darkest room.
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	 "Then gradually remove him from that dark room and return him to his usual activities.
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	 "And know that in surgery, the student is not excused from some observations, so be prepared for the operation.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	 "And it has reached us that one of those who are in the Artach region did something, and some say that he made fire in the Ayrac district by piercing with a needle through which water is drawn.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel. E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	 "And these are the forms of needle types for which one should be aware who does not know them:

Capitol .xxiv.	 Capitol XXIV.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	 Of the treatment for flesh eaten away in the nose.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	 When in the nose diverse fleshy growths appear, which have some resemblance to the sting of a scorpion or to polyps; and this illness is called polyps because it resembles that particular fish.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	 And if the flesh is cancerous, scaly, and of a dark color; but if it is lion's flesh, it is not of a dark color.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	 Therefore, for that which is in these lion's flesh, neither fraudulent nor cancerous, it is necessary to make the patient sit between your hands and place them in the sun, and open the nostrils of him, and prick with your finger in those fleshes.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	 Then extract that which has spread to the outer parts, and then cut with a sharp, fine spatula from one part into another until you know that all the flesh is removed; for if any cause remains by which removal is possible, then you should scrape it with one of the fine instruments with ease until no cause remains.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	 But if it bleeds or develops an abscess, then you should do what is necessary; whether it is one of the malignant abscesses, then you cauterize and cauterize it until blood is drawn and all the cavities are removed.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	 And then place your hand over the patient's nose near the nostrils and apply grease or oil.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	 But if the nose is open and moisture proceeds from it into the throat, then know that it has already healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	 But if the moisture does not penetrate as it should, then know that inside there is flesh rotting in the upper parts of the nose bones, which has not been properly drained.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	 Therefore, it is necessary to introduce fat into the wound, and put compresses on it, placing between each compress the size of the said finger or hand, and bandage the patient and insert one end of the fat into the nose with a reed or another suitable instrument.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	 And after doing this, let the patient's own scent enter until it reaches the nostril channels, and let it settle on its own. For many times children in schools do something similar to this action, and it is an easy thing for one who wants to do it.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l‚Äôautra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	 Then place the two ends of the fat, one end protruding from the nose and the other remaining inside the nose, and then apply a flesh clamp with the compresses that are on the fat, and do this until you know that the flesh is tightly secured with the compresses of the fat.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l‚Äôenguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	 And then extract the bile, and place in the nose near the blood vessel a clove, and do this for three days or more until the ointment has completely dissolved all that is softened from the flesh.

Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	 This ailment which is sometimes present in the tongue can be either congenital, meaning one is born with it, or acquired through an illness that has already healed.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio. Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca. E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	 The procedure for this is to open the patient's mouth and position them facing the sun, then examine the abscess.

Capitol .xl.	 Chapter 40
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	 In which is the summary of the discussion on abscesses and their incision.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	 Abscesses are many kinds, of many types, as will be remembered from their descriptions in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz. E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	 And there are some abscesses that should not be pierced until the crisis of the illness in them or their completion.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que¬∑s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que¬∑l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	 And other abscesses should be punctured when they are ripe and not yet fully developed, such as those near the joints, because an abscess that is close to a joint has its being prolonged until it can be emptied, and the ligaments or nerves of that joint are easily corrupted, causing contraction of that limb. Or if the abscess is near a main member, delaying its puncture until it matures can cause putrefaction in the main member; or if it is near the anus, then puncture it before it has matured to prevent the contents from spreading inside and forming a fistula, or for any other reason that may not heal.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	 But you should know the time for the puncturing of the abscess, and this is when it is ripe.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	 And you should know that it is ripe when there is a reduction in pain and the end of fever, along with a decrease in swelling and pulse, and the sharpness of the abscess head, and other signs.

De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	 On the incision of abscesses that occur at the back of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	 In the back of the head, small abscesses and species of nodules that contain tunics at their tips; and the species of these are many.

Capitol .xliii.	 Chapter XLIII
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	 On the incision of the head of an abscess occurring in the groin.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	 The text means: "The ancients said this section in the epilepsy, and we have not seen anyone in our land who has done it." Here's a line-by-line translation:
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	 And this is the inscription of the sermon of those (people).
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	 But in men having scrotal hernia, the extraction of the testicle must be avoided, because water does not help at all since all the veins and main vessels of the patient are located here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	 But in those who have abscesses caught in the mouth or throat or both ears, when the illness is not in the neck, it is necessary to use the section of the testicle to avoid the loss which is made by infection.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	 Therefore, when we want to do this, we must cut off the testicle after three circles of the testicular circles, or four with a small section through the middle in that which is between two circles for quantity, so that the section be at the spermatic cord, not at the cartilage. And this place is suitable for section because it is devoid of flesh and its blood vessels are thin.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	 And if the doctor is timid, he should then extend the gullet with an ounce (of some substance), and immediately split the gullet until it reaches the esophagus, but avoid the blood vessels if you see any of those as a cause.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	 Then cut the uvula as we have recommended; and it is indicated for the section of the esophagus due to the inflammation which comes from that area with water that has been disrupted and by the absence of speech.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	 And let the wound remain open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	 So when the hour arrives that was expected for the perforation, add two lips of the coden (cord?) to the wound and sew it up with just thread (without using glue or other substances).
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	 Then administer medicines that cause new flesh to grow until it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	 And Ibn Al-Zakariya (Albucasis) says that the sum of what we have discussed is this: some of these apostemes (abscesses or boils) already take away the life force of the patient, and the patient comes close to death, and his breath becomes shallow. Some people cut open the epiglottis so that the patient can breathe over the place of the wound for some breathing, and thus be saved from death.

De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	 On the removal of stones from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	 Stones in women are rarely formed.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	 But if any woman has stones, then the cure is difficult and it is forbidden by many means.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	 One of them is that the woman should be very strong and pure.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	 And the second is that you will not find a woman who knows herself well enough to tell the doctor when she is chaste or if she has had a husband.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	 The third is that you will not find a woman who knows this art well, especially the operation with the hand.
E la quarta es que¬∑l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor. Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	 But if necessity compels you to this, then you must take a woman doctor who is very skilled, and she is rarely found.

E aprop pausa sobre le loc coto e lia aquel e layssa aquel, per so que corro le romanent de l‚Äôaygua.	 And then place something over the area to absorb and remove any remaining water.
E aprop cura aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	 And then care for it until the wound is healed.
Mays si contrarietat es a la egrecio de l‚Äôaygua en aquela hora tu perforas aquela: e aquo no es fayt sino per aquo quar le pannicol blanc en le orrifici de la plagua fa contrarietat e prohibeys le eyssiment de l‚Äôaygua, lahoras cove que tu metas en la plagua pena o instrument am la qual es extrayta l‚Äôaygua dels ydropitz, la forma del qual es precedida; o ajusta en la opprecio de la plagua un petit.	 But if there is resistance to the exit of water at that time, you should puncture it: and this is done only because the white membrane in the orifice of the wound hinders and prevents the exit of water. Therefore, you must insert into the wound a pen or instrument with which water is extracted from drops, as described earlier; or adjust a small tube in the opening of the wound.  (Note: "le pannicol blanc" likely refers to what we now call fascia, a thin white membrane that covers muscles and organs.)
E sapias que l‚Äôaygua retorna, e es agueguada aprop vi meses o enaviro aquels; e cum es agreguada, lahoras sia perforat segon aquela meteyssa manieyra, quar le malaute ayssi passara les sieus dias.	 And know that the water may return, and it can be accumulated for about six months or a year; and when it is accumulated, then it should be punctured in the same manner, because the patient will thus extend their life.
Capitol .lxiii.	 Chapter 63.
De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	 On incision for a flesh-covered hernia and its treatment.
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor.	 Know that in the incision of this type of hernia, there is great danger in the major structures; therefore, I have seen its removal and being saved by this method.
E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	 And I am recalling the procedure for that and the types of aposteme.
Donc, dic que l‚Äòapostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	 Therefore, I say that apostemes are born in the bodies of those whose humors are corrupted, and this happens for many reasons: either due to an acute bitter superfluity, which is poured into the humors, or due to trauma.
E es la color de la apostema segon la color del cos, e no es atrobat en lu dolor, e es apostema greu.	 And its color corresponds to that of the body, and it does not cause pain, indicating a serious aposteme.
E fort leu es apostema lapificada, del qual la color es fosca, e no es centiment a lu.	 A strong and light one is called a lithified aposteme, whose color is dark, and it is insensitive.
E alcunas veguadas es fayt per nodacio de las arcerias, e per imflacio de aquelas ayssi quo ja es perceubut la rememoracio de lu, o per imflacio de venas.	 And sometimes it is caused by the swelling of the arteries, and by the inflammation of those so that its memory is already perceived, or by the inflammation of veins.
Mays aquo que es per imflacio de arcerias es conogut per la dispercio de la apostema quan compremas aquela am les tieus ditz; e no cove que aquel toques.	 But what is caused by the inflammation of the arteries is known by the dispersion of the aposteme when you press it with your fingers; and it should not be touched.
Mays aquel que es fayt per imflacio de vena no es dispergut de lu alcuna causa deves la compressio am les ditz.	 But that which is caused by the inflammation of veins does not disperse at all due to any pressure with your fingers.
E ja es possible que sobre aquesta specia sia fayta seccio e sobre les autres carns; e es que tu inscida la codena dels genetius, e aprop esten le huou a las partidas desus, e extratz aquel del ciphac blanc, e deliura le suspensori dels vaysels, e ligua les, e inscideys le suspensori pus que tu deliuras aquel de tota partida de las partidas del huou.	 And it is possible to perform a section on this type and on other tissues; and that you incise the sheath of the humors, and then extend the hole to the parts above, and extract that which is white, and deliver the suspensory ligaments of the vessels, and tie them, and incise the ligaments after you have delivered it from all parts of the egg.
Donc si l‚Äôhuou ja es am aquelas carnadas consolida, lahoras cove que tu extraguas le huou e inscidas aquel.	 If the flesh has already hardened with those meats, then it is necessary for you to remove the meat and inject it again.
E si es adherencia entro alcuna causa del ciphac, o entre aquo que es entre les bayssels, lahoras cove que tu deliures tota aquela adherencia e inscidas aquela per inscizio redonda.	 If there is an adhesion due to any cause of the hernia, or between the parts that are between the muscles, then it is necessary for you to remove all that adhesion and inject it with a round injection.
Mays si es nativitat de carn en le loc de la adherencia la qual es detras, lahoras cove que tu inscidas tot aquo que es de lu, e extraguas le huou ayssi cum havem dit.	 But if there is a growth of flesh in the place of the adhesion which is behind, then it is necessary for you to inject all that is from it, and remove the meat as we have said.
Donc cum es complida la tua operacio, lahoras omple la plagua de lana imfuza en oli rozat e vi; e aprop cura aquela am l‚Äôautra curacio entro que sia sanat.	 Therefore, when your operation is completed, then fill the wound with lanolin infused in rose oil and wine; and afterwards care for it with another treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .lxiv.	 Chapter LXIV.
De la curacio de hernia que es de vitz.	 About the treatment of a hernia caused by wind.
Vit es apostema envolut per alcuna envolucio semblant a broto am mollificacio dels testiculs, e es fayt dificil movement exercitiu e deambulacio sobre le malaute. E en la curacio de aquesta malautia es per temor per aquo del qual es precedida rememoracio.	 And in the treatment of this illness, one should be mindful of what comes before it.
Empero cove que diguam opperacio en aquela segon que fero les primiers.	 Nevertheless, we must say operation on that according to what was done by the first [doctors].
E dic que cove que fassas sezer le malaute sobre una cezelha elevada; e aprop enpelleys le suspensori dels testiculs a las partidas dejos; e aprop te la codena dels genetius am les tieus ditz am les baysels que so probdas a la vergua; e tengua aquels autre ministre que tu, e extenda aquels am extencio vehement.	 And I say that it is necessary to seat the patient on an elevated chair; and then unfasten the suspenders of the testicles from the lower parts; and then take the girdle of the genitals with your words, which have been proven in the penis; and let those other ministers that you have extend them with great extension.
E aprop inscideys am spatum lat agut per seccio traversa en le dreyt dels vaysels entro que sian les vayssels descubertz.	 And then make an incision with a sharp, thin blade through the right side of the vessels until the vessels are exposed.

E aprop inscideys aquels en le mieg loc per seccio dreyta segon la longuesa del cos, e extratz aquo que es agreguat de las humiditatz fetulentas e corruptas.	 And then make a straight incision in the middle of those places according to the length of the body, and extract what is added from the foul and corrupt humors.
E aprop cura la plagua am curacio de las autras plaguas en las quals vols sania esser engendrada per so que caian les vaysels les quals noyreysso un de dos genetius, quar no es mal per aquo.	 And then treat the wound with the treatment of other wounds in which you want health to be generated, so that the vessels that connect one of two genitals may fall away, for it is not a bad thing for this.
Mays si accideys vit a totz les bayssels, lahoras cove que¬∑ls testicols sian extragutz o que les testicols per aquo se cequo am les vayssels, per que sia privat de tot nutriment per la inscizio dels vayssels, e que sian estaborits, o que cequo per so que no sia juvament am aquels.	 If it happens to all the vessels, then the testicles must be extracted or tied with the vessels, so that he is deprived of all nourishment due to the cutting of the vessels, and thus they will shrink, or tied for this reason, so that he cannot have intercourse with those.
Capitol .lxv.	 Cap√≠tulo LXV
De la cura de hernia entestinal.	 On the care of intestinal hernias.
Le adveniment de aquesta hernia es per seccio que endeve en le ciphac extendut sobre le ventre de part dels angunars del mirac del ventre, per que deysendo les budels de aquela ruptura ad alcu dels budels.	 The occurrence of this hernia is due to a section that extends in the abdomen from the lower parts of the intestines, because some of the intestines descend from that rupture and fall into the scrotum or the labia majora.
E aquesta ruptura es o del ciphac o de excencio de lu, e accideysso aquestas doas specias per motas causas: o percussio, o per sautz, o per clamor, o per elevacio de alcuna causa greu, o per semblantz.	 And this rupture occurs either in the abdomen or in its extension, and these two types occur for various reasons: by blows, jumps, shouts, lifting of some heavy object, or similar things.
E¬∑l senhal de aquo, quan es per extencio del ciphac, es que accideys pauc a pauc en lonc temps, e no accideys soptament, e es apostema engual entro ves le preon per so quar le ciphac comprem le budel.	 And the sign of this, when it is by extension of the abdomen, is that it occurs gradually over a long time, and does not occur suddenly, and it is a swelling that is inside the peritoneum because the abdomen presses on the intestine.
E le senhal de lu es quan es per seccio del ciphac, quar al comensament fa accidir dolor vehement sobtament; e es apostema divers aparent dejos la codena propdana aparent, e aquo es per eyssiment del budel, e¬∑l cos de lu a las partidas deforo del ciphac.	 And the sign of it is when it is by rupture of the abdomen, because at the beginning it causes sudden and severe pain; and it is a swelling that appears below the navel, and this is due to the protrusion of the intestine, and its body is outside the abdomen.
E alcunas veguadas es fora-getat am le budel la tela, e es apelada aquesta hernia entestinal zirbal.	 And sometimes the tunic is also protruded with the intestine, and this type of intestinal hernia is called scrotal.
E alcunas veguadas es fayta am ventositat, e alcunas veguadas corr en le budel fenda, e aqui es retenguda, e es am aquo gran pernitia3 del malaute, e alcunas veguadas fa endevenir dolor malvada e majorment quan es premut.	 And sometimes it is caused by flatulence, and sometimes the intestine may rupture, causing great harm to the patient, and sometimes it leads to severe pain, especially when pressed.
E en la curacio de las especias de aquesta malautia am ferr es temor, per que cove que sia esquivat le cazament en aquela.	 And in the treatment of this type of illness with iron, there is fear, because it is necessary to avoid the blow in that area.
E la manieyra de la operacio de aquela es que comandes al malaute que redugua le budel am la sua ma a las partidas dedintz de la sua conquavitat si obezeys al sieu retornament, e aprop sia envessat sobre le sieu col entre las tuas mas, e eleva las cambas de lu.	 And the way to operate is to instruct the patient to return the intestine with their hand to its inner parts if they comply with the retraction, and then place yourself over their neck between your hands, and lift their legs.
E aprop sten la codena la qual siec la codena dels testicols a las partidas desus, e inscideys la codena dels testicols tota per le lonc; e aprop fiqua en doas labias de la seccio uncis segon que indigeysses a hubrir la seccio am aquels. E si‚Äô la seccio segon la quantitat que a tu sia possible que de aquela le huou sia foro-getat.	 And if, according to the quantity that you can manage, from there the wound is enlarged.

The given sentence appears to describe a medical procedure involving the testicle (testicol) and surrounding areas. Let's break it down line by line:
E aprop mau am la ma la codena dels testicols a las partidas deforo, e am aysso exten le ciphac blanc en sus am la ma sinestra, e eleva le huou am le ciphac a la partida de la seccio; e comanda al ministre que extenda le huou ensus e tu dissolveys la adherencia que es detras am solucio complida.	 And then, with your left hand, take the cord of the testicles outside to the divided part, and with this, extend the white cloth in your left hand, and lift the egg with the cloth to the sectioned part; and command the assistant to extend the egg further, and you dissolve the adhesion that is behind it with a complete solution.
E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	 And be sure to tell them that there should be no reason for the intestine to be wrapped in the white cloth.
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	 But if you find any such cause, then peel it off from the belly immediately.
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	 And then you take a needle with a thick thread made of x threads, and insert it through the back of the cloth that is under the cord of the testicles, which we have called section; and then cut the ends that protrude from the thread until there are four threads, and then attach some of them on top of each other in the shape of a cross; and tie with this the cloth that we said is below the cord of the testicles with strong binding on both sides.
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	 And then wrap the ends of the threads and tie them securely so that none of the vessels that nourish them can transmit any cause, lest an aposteme occurs here.
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	 And place another blanket on the patient, similar to the first blanket, three feet away from them; and then from this second blanket leave a space which is below the neck of the testicles, the size of a thumb, and incise all the remaining according to its roundness, and remove the egg from them.
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	 And then incise in the area below the neck of the testicles so that blood and pus flow out, as we have recommended in what has been said.
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	 And then apply wool soaked in oil to the wound and place it there; and administer the blanket we have recommended (and sometimes the white cloth is cauterized, which we said after the incision to prevent bleeding, because often this happens) and leave the blanket until it falls off by itself.
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	 But if the falling off is delayed, then dip it in hot water and place it on there until it falls off as we have said.
E aprop cura la plagua am l‚Äôautra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	 And then treat the wound with the other wound treatment until it is healed.

De hernia ventosa.	 Of a hernia with a cavity or pouch.

Capitol .lxix.	 Chapter 69
De castracio.	 About castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que¬∑m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l‚Äôautra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	 Know that castration in our law is forbidden, but I have heard of it for reasons that I remember here in this book; and the remembrance of it is not necessary except in two ways. One way is so that this is in the knowledge of the doctor when he is asked about it, that he knows the cure for those to whom it happens; and the other way is that we have often had need of castration of other animals for our benefit from them, such as mules, and goats, and pigs, and similar animals.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	 And so I say that castration is done in two ways: either by traction or by incision and amputation.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que¬∑ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	 But in the case done by traction, the procedure is that we castrate the animal in hot water until its testicles are softened and loosened and hang down.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	 Then take those with your hand until they are resolved and do not appear below the touch.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	 But in castration done by incision and amputation, it is necessary that you hold the animal and press its tail with your left hand.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	 Then tie off the suspensory ligaments, and make an incision on each testicle with a scissor until two testicles are processed.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	 Then cut those afterwards that you will have skinned each one.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	 And do not leave on those any scab, except a subtle one which is over the vessels.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	 And this method of castration is better which is done by traction, because traction leaves little or no cause for the testicles to cause the animal to desire heat [i.e., it reduces the risk of infection and inflammation].
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	 Then heal the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lxx.	 **Cap√≠tulo 70** (or Chapter 70)
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	 Of the treatment of hermaphrodites.
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l‚Äôespazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels. E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	 And the treatment is of three kinds: two for men and one for women.

De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	 About the care of the sinews and the quality of the enema with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e¬∑l spazi de l‚Äôapostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	 When an abscess occurs in some fleshy members and the space of the abscess is prolonged until it forms a cavity, and then it breaks and perforates, and the pus comes out from it, leaving the place empty as if it were a vessel, and the skin that is above it is also thin like a fine cloth, and no deeper corruption has reached, and does not affect bone or nerve or ligament, it is called a sinew, and not a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	 However, if the space is extended to the point where corruption begins in any part of the body, it is called a fistula and not an ulcer.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	 And the treatment for it is that you should cut that string completely as it is rolled up, especially when it is thin and made of cloth. Make sure it does not stick to the place due to its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri. Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	 Second Chapter: On Fractures That Occur in the Head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	 There are many types of fractures, and their forms vary, as do their causes. Some fractures are caused by blunt trauma, which shatters the entire bone and leaves a fragment, just like splitting a stick; this type is called comminuted. Or the blunt object cuts through part of the bone but does not penetrate all the way through it; this type of fracture is called a greenstick fracture.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	 The wound from these two types of fractures can be either large or small. Fractures caused by crushing or tearing forces are due to blunt trauma or falling onto a rock, and they have similar appearances.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca. E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	 And there is another type of fracture that occurs within the bone itself, in the subtlety of its fibers; for this reason, this type of fracture is called hairline.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	 And it is a fracture that is caused either by falling or by the impact of stone or similar objects, which makes some splinter of bone enter into the divided depths, and it is made in the concave place as happens to clay pots when they are hit and their entrance is divided into the divided depths.

Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu. E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	 And it is because it is not uniform across all those who have studied this art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	 And we will now discuss what we have written about large fractures.  (In this case, "stec" is an archaic form of "parlar", which means "to speak".)
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	 And if the skin is cut when you extract the bone, then it is necessary to take a cloth according to the size of the wound, and soak it in rose oil, and place it on the opening of the wound; and then take another cloth folded or tripled and soak it in wine and rose oil and place it over the first cloth, and apply that lightly with the pus, as much as you can without burdening the flesh; and then administer a thin bandage, and do not tighten it more than the wound itself.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	 And leave that person with this care for one day or two until you are sure of the abscess caut; then unbind him and administer medicines which are superfluous dryness, such as linseed oil and barley flour, and powder of violets and of aristolochia, and similar to those.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	 And it is that you make from these medicines a powder which is sprinkled over the wound, as they are dry; and generally, administer to him every medicine of the property of which it is that it should absorb and not sting.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	 And be careful according to your skill that the wound in your care is clean; and there should not be any putrefaction or other in it; nor let you allow any virulence to increase in it; for when it is attached to the panniculus of the brain, it corrupts that and poisons that, and it happens to the patient something malignant.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	 And it happens in the cavity of the head, as its bone is denuded and especially when its care is neglected, and there is blackness on its surface; and therefore consider if such accidents happen to the patient as we have said, know that it is pernicious without any doubt.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat. De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	 "On the restoration of the nose when it is broken.

De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	 On the restoration of the jaw when it has been broken.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	 When the jaw has been broken and the fracture is not caused by a wound, consider whether the fracture is only on the outside and not split into two parts, curving inward. In this case, its cure is easy.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam. E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema. E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	 "And if the opening of the wound is narrow, then you should widen it with a fleam (surgical instrument) according to your need.

Capitol .vii.	 Chapter VII.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	 On the restoration of a foot fracture.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	 The foot sometimes breaks in the middle of it and that delays; but the ends of it move because they are twisted and crushed.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	 And of its symptoms when it is broken in the middle, it swells towards the inside and a great pain occurs, and there is difficulty in breathing, coughing, a strong fever, and vomiting blood; and it is evident in the cavity of the broken bone and is not hidden from feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	 And its restoration is that the patient be placed on their back, and a cushion be put between their shoulders; and then press on the muscles of the patient, and adjust the ribs of the patient with the hands of two assistants, and be careful in the operation of it and in the setting as much as possible according to what is convenient for that, until the shape of the bone returns as needed.

Capitol .viii.	 **Translation**: Chapter VIII

Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	 **Translation**: Know that the fracture of the ribs occurs only in large areas such as the back, and at their ends on the front side, this condition does not occur except due to the fact that they are cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	 **Translation**: And its identification is not hidden from sensation; you should recognize it through the following signs:
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	 **Translation**: And the restoration should be done in such a way that you reduce the fracture with the aforementioned methods, as is possible, until it is healed according to what is needed, and then apply and strengthen the broken bones with a bandage, if necessary.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	 **Translation**: And if the fracture of the ribs protrudes towards their ends inside, then a severe pain and puncture occur in the patient, like the puncture that occurs to someone with pleurisy, and this happens because the bone pierces the membrane; and difficulty in breathing, coughing, and vomiting blood also occur; and this is difficult to cure.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	 **Translation**: And the ancients have ingeniously addressed this with many ingenious methods.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	 **Translation**: And of these, they said: it is necessary to give the patient foods that produce flatulence and bloating, so that the belly becomes distended and extended, and the fracture is pushed outwards towards its ends.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	 "But we avoid this so that it is not an easy cause to generate a post-cautery abscess; and if it does happen, then it already helps with that.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	 "And some say that it should be placed on a cupping glass and sucked with great strength; and this seems reasonable, but there is fear that the cupping will draw superfluities to the area due to weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que¬∑l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	 "And some say that the area should be covered with wool that has been soaked in oil, and pillows should be placed between the ribs until it is filled, ensuring the bandage is equal in width as you wrap it around according to its roundness; and then treat the patient with a diet of pleuresia and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel. Then we should saw through the bone easily and remove it.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	 "And then we join the two lips of the wound with stitches if it is large, and treat it with dressings until it heals.

Capitol .ix.	 Chapter IX
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	 Of the restoration of a fracture in the spine of the back and of the neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	 Sometimes it happens that there is a fracture in the bones of the neck, and later their attrition, and similarly in the spine of the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	 And if it happens to someone and you want to know if he will be healed or not, then consider this: that if you see his hands already softened and stupefied and dead, and he cannot move those nor extend them nor strengthen those; and when you press those with your fingers or prick those with a needle and he feels no pain in those, then know that it is not healed, and such disposition is mortal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l‚Äôos es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio. E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	 And if you see on the vertebrae of the neck something that appears like this and you want to know whether it will heal or not, then consider his feet.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	 Then if you see that they are already softened, do to him what has been done on the hands, and next when he lies down on his back, there is windiness and diarrhea without his will, and sometimes he rolls onto his back wanting to urinate but cannot, then know that it is fatal, and at that point do not attempt a cure for him.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	 But if none of those causes occur, the cause is better and lighter.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	 And the cure for it is that you pierce the abscess carefully and place over the injured vertebra a cloth soaked in warm olive oil, or with mullein flowers boiled; place this on it several times during the day until the abscess is subsided.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	 Then place one of the strengthening and soothing poultices, and bind it tightly; and command the patient to rest and be still, and not to sleep on the side where he feels pain until he is healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	 And if it happens that there is fracture of the bone or some other cause already separated from him, then it is necessary to cauterize over the wound and extract that bone; and next approximate the two lips of the wound, with sutures if it is large; and next cure it with some healing ointment until it is healed.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l‚Äôautra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	 If the last bone of the toe is broken and it is the tip of the toe, then you should insert the said finger of your left hand into the anus, and hold the broken bone with the other hand as possible according to the balance; and then place over it a plaster and a splint if you have those, and then strengthen that.
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	 If you feel broken bones in him, then cut (open) over that area, remove the shattered pieces, and treat the wound with the prescribed treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	 Chapter 10
De restauracio de la ancha.	 About restoring the soul.
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura. Capitol .xi.	 Chapter XI.

Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	 A finger is what is between the elbow and the shoulder joint.

Capitol .xii.	 Chapter XII.
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	 Of the repair of a broken arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l‚Äôautre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	 The arm is composed of two bones which are called two forks; one of them is small and it is that which is said to be the thumb, and the other is large and it is placed below the small bone from the side closer to the bottom.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	 And very often only the larger fork breaks or the smaller one, and very often they break together.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	 And when the small fork breaks above, then its repair is easy and its healing is even easier.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	 And when it breaks below, the fracture of it is bad and its healing is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	 And even worse than that is when both bones break together.
Donc si l‚Äôos le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	 Therefore, if the bone that is broken is the small fork above, then it is fitting for the physician to make a slight extension with ease until that bone is equalized.
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	 But if it is the large fork that is broken, then it is necessary to make a more vigorous extension.
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	 If both tongs are clamped together, then you must press the cautery much stronger.
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	 It is necessary to place the patient in the recovery position with their arm extended on a pillow, and have their hand resting above [their head], because all the other things mentioned, and the auricular [ear] should be lower than the others, and the patient should be sitting on a low chair.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que¬∑l malaute no encorra trebalh.	 And there should be a pillow in front of the patient at their height or level, so that the patient does not encounter difficulty.
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	 And then the assistant should extend the arm of the higher part with their hand or with a bandage, and another assistant should do the same on top.
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	 And then the physician should envelop the bones within until they reduce them in the best possible way.
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	 And if there are splinters in the bone fracture, then you should remove all of them from their place with your skill.
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	 And if it appears that the splinter has separated and is puncturing the spinal cord and you are not hopeful for the patient's recovery, then you should operate on them and remove it according to the manner we have said above.
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	 But if the fracture is with a wound, I have already dealt with that in another chapter, so take care of it accordingly.

De sermo en dislocacio.	 About speech and dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	 A dislocation is the displacement of one of its joints from its original position, preventing movement, distorting the figure of the limb, and causing severe pain and injury to the patient.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	 Therefore, when a dislocation occurs, it is necessary to immediately attempt to reduce it and not delay the reduction, for if it is delayed, the place swells up and becomes difficult to reduce due to water.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	 And for this reason, it should not be moved or stretched at the time of swelling, because many times it causes spasm and severe pain.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat. De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	 On the treatment of a lower jaw dislocation.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	 So if both jaws are dislocated; and the dislocation of both is done in one of two ways: either they are slightly displaced from their places by little movement, and they are softened a little; or they are completely dislocated until they are softened at the joint, to the point that the patient drools and cannot hold it or close his mouth, and his tongue is wrapped in its place.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	 But when the displacement is slight, then in most cases it returns by itself with little effort.

Capitol .xxvi.	 Chapter 26.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	 On reducing the dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que¬∑l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	 Know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways. One way is that it is dislocated from the attachment to the tendon to the lower part.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	 The second way is that it is dislocated from the upper attachment of the muscle, and this is done rarely. It is not dislocated at the attachments behind the shoulder nor at the attachments in front near the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	 This sentence appears to describe the situation where a joint has become dislocated and pushed out of its normal position. The difficulty in reducing (relocating) the joint depends on the amount of surrounding tissue or fat. Here's a line-by-line translation:
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	 When a severe blow or fall occurs to certain men, and their muscle becomes swollen with an acute inflammation, it is suspected that the joint may be dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	 Therefore, you should probe this area until you are certain about it, and then proceed with the treatment of him.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e¬∑l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	 And the dislocation of him is known when you tickle at the lower part; so that you may distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the healthy one, for you will find clear differences among them; and you will find in the head of the muscle a concavity, and after tickling you should touch the head of the muscle like an egg, and the patient cannot bring his hand to his ear, nor move it at all.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	 If it is dislocated, you should feel the foot or ankle, and then you will find a clear sensation, not hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	 And from this dislocation, a slight reduction is made when it is recent and the patient is a child.

And the reduction of him is that the attendant raises his hand to the upper part; and then places his fingers below the tickling area, and raises the joint with strength back to its place, and the attendant raises his hand, and extends it forward; and then places it below because it returns lightly.

Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost. The thickness of the stick should be tapered at both ends like this:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que¬∑l fust no ledesca le malaute.	 And immediately place some soft cloths on top to prevent the stick from hurting the patient.

E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	 And when the treatment is completed according to whatever method you have used, then place a woolen pad of appropriate size under the thighs; next, apply a plaster made from powdered poppy seeds and egg white over all the muscles, wrapping it around as needed. Then bind the thigh tightly with a decent bandage; wrap the bandage over the plaster, and tie the patient's hand to their neck, leaving it undisturbed for seven days, without moving the hand.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que¬∑l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	 And it is advisable that the patient's food be taken in small amounts until the limb is comforted, because it is easier for their healing.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	 And the food should be given more often, around seven or five times, and exercise should be done; if it is firm and not softened, then it is healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	 But if the joint is dislocated many times due to humidity that affects it or for another reason, then in that case a cautery with three holes should be applied, as was said before in the chapter on cauteries.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que¬∑ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	 And if all this is done and after seven days the bandage is removed and the joint is not firm, and the plaster and constriction are applied to it several times, and it is still not firm and does not allow the arm to be raised above, then know that the nerves of the patient, which are at the top of the muscle, are already cut or stretched or softened, and know that the joint will never again be put in its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu‚Äôes fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne. E sia administrada en aquela l‚Äôautra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	 And administer it in that other constriction, and care for it until it is healed.
