And if it so happens that the healing causes heaviness in the limb and slowness in its movement, then the patient should use warm baths until that heaviness is alleviated and the limb returns to its original state.
Capitol .xxvii.	 Chapter 27
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	 On the treatment of shoulder dislocation.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	 Know that the shoulder joint is dislocated with difficulty and likewise returns with difficulty; it can be dislocated in all directions, but most commonly forward or backward. The dislocation of the joint is not hidden from you because it changes the appearance or sensation according to which direction it was dislocated. When you reduce the dislocated shoulder with a needle, this is clearly indicated to you, for the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm or touch its own muscle.
E cove que¬∑t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	 And it is necessary that you cut and reduce the dislocation as soon as possible, before it reaches the stage of a hard swelling, because if it reaches the stage of a hard swelling, the reduction will be difficult, and even if it does heal, it will not be completely cured; this is especially true when the dislocation is posterior, for it is the most severe of all types of dislocation, causing great pain, and many people die from it.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	 Here's a line-by-line translation of the provided sentence:
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	 If the dislocation is at the front of the body, then return (the limb) in such a way that you fold the hand with its own hand, until it strikes the elbow with the back of the palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	 And if the dislocation does not obey the reduction, then apply very strong extension and a lot of force.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	 And it is that two assistants should extend the arm, and hold it in this manner with two assistants, so that it is not moved away from the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	 Then the arm should be turned in all directions, since it is wrapped with a long folded cloth around the patient's hand or bandage.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	 And when the physician touches the joint with his hand, anoint that with some oil so that it may have those properties which help in the lubrication of the joint with ease; and then press the joint strongly until it returns (to its original position).
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e¬∑l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	 Then the reduction of it requires that it be placed on a plaster which has been made with adstringent and astringent properties, using egg white, and it should be drawn tight with strict pressure, and the arm should be suspended from the neck, and left for several days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	 Then it should be unwrapped; and if the joint is formed in its proper place, then you can unwrap the bandage from the patient and leave it thus.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e¬∑l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	 And if the joint is not strengthened, then you should apply another plaster and bandage, and leave it for several days until it is strengthened; then remove it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	 And if something serious happens near the reduction of the joint and his condition is restless, then administer moistening in baths and subtle friction, and compressions until he is relieved; or place on the joint poultices, which are large cloths; and then bind it, and leave it on the bone day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	 And then remove that, and put him in a bath; and when he gets out, then rub the joint with cool friction, and then apply on it poultices, which are round cloths, once, and again, and a third time.
am intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	 in the mixture of bath, until it is softened.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	 And if you wish, place on it a wet and scraped cowhide bandage and bind it tightly; and do this several times, because that is moist and returns to its condition.
Capitol .xxviii.	 Chapter 28.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre¬∑l bras e la ma.	 About the treatment of dislocation of the shoulder, which is the joint between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e¬∑l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	 Certainly! Let's translate the given text line by line:
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	 And the reduction of the dislocation is that you place the joint of the patient's hand on a table and make him extend his hand, and the doctor places his hand or palm on the prominence of the joint, and pushes it until it returns to its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	 However, it must be considered whether the palm is already torn away from the hand. If that's the case, then the patient should place the back of his hand on a table facing upwards for extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is towards the back of the hand, then the position of the patient's hand should be intrinsically on the table, so that the doctor's hand falls on that prominence of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	 And thus, if it returns immediately, that's good; and if not, then strengthen it with a poultice to soften the swelling and leave it; and do not repeat this, for otherwise, neither will you tolerate nor be able to bear the reduction of pus that follows on the next day.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa. Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada. Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	 But if the patient's movement is obstructed and they suffer some gravity, then apply hot water and friction to that area several times until relief is achieved.
Capitol .xxix.	 Chapter 29
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	 On the treatment of dislocations of said parts.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	 Sometimes these parts are completely dislocated.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	 And when one of these fingers is dislocated on the back of the hand or palm, then straighten the finger and push the dislocation with your thumbs until it returns to its proper position.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	 And then support the tip of the finger and suspend it above the area where it was dislocated for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	 Then suspend it and extend it until it is straightened in its own day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	 And at night, bandage it according to the aforementioned method, and do not stop unwrapping it during the day and moving it about, and then rebandage it at night; continue this process for several days until it is healed.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	 And do the same with water if it is dislocated on the back of the hand, and bandage it to that area and do with water the first operation mentioned above until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	 And similarly, apply water when it is dislocated in other parts of the body.
Capitol .xxx.	 Chapter .xxx.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	 Of the treatment for the dislocation of the spine of the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	 When it happens to any of the vertebrae in the back or neck that they are completely dislocated and have moved from their places, then there is no cure for this, because death approaches the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	 And the sign of this is that the patient's bowel movement is involuntary and cannot be held; and many times some members of him are paralyzed, or both legs or both arms, or one of them; or a vertebra has been moved from its place, because sometimes it is moved and sometimes the movement of those [vertebrae] occurs in four directions.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	 Therefore, when it has already moved to the back parts, it is called scoliosis.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	 But the cure for it is that one should consider if the scoliosis occurs in childhood, because then there is no cure and it will not heal completely.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	 But for those that come from a fall or a blow or something similar to these, the ancients have already spoken of the manners of cure with long discourses, from which the most profitable returns; but I have already abbreviated it, because the little [that] escapes from the excess [of the text], for my closeness to my own understanding, with which I have explained and formed this from different instruments than those with which I will show and explain it.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	 And I say that the gout which occurs in the front part of the foot has neither cause nor cure; similarly, this is true for that which occurs at two latches.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	 And those are not cured except for the one that occurs in the back specifically with what I recommend.
E es que¬∑l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	 And the patient should be extended on their back near a wall, and under them should be placed a moist instrument to prevent their feet from moving.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l‚Äôautra extremitat del pueg.	 And then place a straight stick in the ground at the head of the patient, and another stick under their feet at the opposite end of the bed.
E¬∑l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l‚Äôautre segon aquela forma.	 And one assistant should hold the stick and it should not be fixed in a hole; and another assistant should hold the other stick in the same manner.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l‚Äôautre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l‚Äôautre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu. De curacio de anca dislocada.	 On the treatment of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat. Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo. E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	 And then leave it for two days or three; and if the bandage becomes softened, remove it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	 And then unwrap it on the third day or the fourth, and forbid the patient from walking for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	 But if he is forced to walk before that time, there is no certainty that the dislocation will not be reabsorbed and corrupted, and so it may not receive healing.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	 And if an abscess happens to him, then you should administer what was previously mentioned in the beginning of this treatise, in another section on treatment and application, until it is removed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	 Chapter XXXIV.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	 On the Treatment of Dislocation of the Toes.
Cove que aquel qu‚Äôes dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	 It is advisable that he who is dislocated be anointed with a little oil without difficulty; and this should not be difficult, but rather easy.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	 "However, if the dislocation is in any of the toes on the bottom of the foot, then it is necessary to make the patient sit with their foot on a level surface on the ground or on a table, and let them remain thus as if they were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	 "And then you stand on your feet, and place your foot on something soft, like the junctures, and then press down with your foot with all your might until it returns to its original position, and you see that it is level and there is no protrusion.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	 "And then place under the sole of their foot a board that supports the entire foot, which has two handles, and then secure it with decent and firm bindings for three days; and then remove it and let them rest from walking for many days, until it is healed and the healing is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	 "Chapter XXXV
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	 "Of the types of dislocation that are made with a blow or with a fracture, or with both together.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	 "When any of these causes occur and you attempt to treat it and restore the patient, many times death occurs.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l‚Äôart, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	 "And for this reason, one should not presume to treat it unless he is wise in the art, with long experience, merciful and compassionate, cautious, not rash or presumptuous; and at the beginning use medicines that restrain inflammation only slightly, and leave the patient to divine judgment, except for those whom you hope will be saved from destruction, with relief from illness, and in which you perceive some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	 And then immediately strive to make a reduction from him at the beginning of the cause, before an abscess is formed.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	 And then if the member returns as we wish, administer a regimen that will prevent an abscess and treat the wound with water from the desiccating ointments.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	 And if the dislocation is with a fracture and happens in the small bones, then you should pierce their surface, and do what we have said previously in simple illnesses concerning water in those places.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	 And guard and avoid, according to your ability, those things that lead to fear in the pathways, as I have previously instructed you; for this is better for you and more pleasing to your Creator, and it will bring greater glory and health to your body in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	 Thus ends the words of Al-Bukhari, may God bless him.
Amen.	 Amen.
